greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n >= 0, k >= 0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is the expansion of Product_{j>=1} 1/(1 - j*x^j)^k.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..200, flattened
formula: G.f. of column k: Product_{j>=1} 1/(1 - j*x^j)^k.
mathematica: Table[Function[k, SeriesCoefficient[Product[1/(1 - i x^i)^k, {i, 1, n}], {x, 0, n}]][j - n], {j, 0, 11}, {n, 0, j}] // Flatten
program: (PARI) first(n, k) = my(res = matrix(n, k)); for(u=1, k, my(col = Vec(prod(j=1, n, 1/(1 - j*x^j)^(u-1)) + O(x^n))); for(v=1, n, res[v, u] = col[v])); res \\ _Iain Fox_, Dec 28 2017
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Dec 28 2017
